input:

26:01 Event: Ball out of play

38:31 Caption: Goal! Andre (FC Porto) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:0.

46:10 Caption: Willian (Chelsea) converts the free kick from about 20 metres out with a perfectly bent shot that ends up inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance. What a shot!
46:20 Caption: The first half of today's match has just finished.
46:59 Caption: There has been no time for the supporters to get bored during an eventful opening 45 minutes. Both teams provided some breathtaking moments. Neither team has really been able to control the flow of the game. Both sides are using combination football to try and gain the upper hand.

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
FC Porto emerged victorious over Chelsea with a thrilling 2-1 win in a highly competitive UEFA Champions League group match. Played at the EstÃ¡dio do DragÃ£o, the game was an intriguing encounter filled with dramatic moments, high intensity, and impressive displays of individual skills from both teams.

### First Half:

The match kicked off with FC Porto maintaining early possession and setting a quick tempo. Within the first couple of minutes, Chelsea managed to get the ball out of play, and both teams were engaged in a series of throw-ins, a reflection of the cautious approach each side adopted initially. FC Porto was the first to demonstrate an attacking threat. By the 1:40 mark, they made their first attempt on target, testing Chelsea's defense early.

Chelsea tried to find their rhythm but was caught offside at 2:55, leading to a series of indirect free-kicks and another attempt by Chelsea which got cleared away by FC Porto's defense. Chelsea managed their first shot on target at around 5:50, indicating their rising confidence as the match progressed. The tempo of the game was frenetic with exchanges of possession, and both defenses were put under significant pressure early on.

Around the 11-minute mark, FC Porto's Danilo smashed a shot from 26 meters out that unfortunately went wide of the right post, resulting in Chelsea's goal kick. Chelsea retaliated with Pedro's effort on target around the 13th minute, but Iker Casillas, the FC Porto goalkeeper, was alert and managed a comfortable save. Diego Costa was caught offside a minute later, disrupting Chelsea's attacking play.

The game saw its first foul around the 14th minute committed by Chelsea, and the consequent free-kick by FC Porto led to a series of corner kicks and shots off target by FC Porto. Ruben Neves, who took multiple corners for Porto, saw his efforts intercepted by Chelseaâ€™s resilient defense. This back-and-forth battle continued as FC Porto bravely blocked shots and Chelsea tried breaking through, resulting in several throw-ins and goal kicks.

Bruno Martins Indi received a yellow card for a late challenge on the 18:28 mark, increasing the tension in the game. Willianâ€™s subsequent free-kick for Chelsea was cleared easily though, showing FC Portoâ€™s defensive organization.

FC Porto's efforts to break through Chelseaâ€™s defense were relentless. By around the 23rd minute, Yacine Brahimiâ€™s attempts to find his teammates with a pass were thwarted by Chelseaâ€™s quick defense.

A series of fouls and indirect free kicks interrupted the flow of the game. Yet another yellow card was issued, this time to Ivan Marcano at the 24:12 minute for bringing down an opponent. The pace of the game remained high with chances being created but not converted. Chelsea continued to press, with Diego Costa getting a shot off at around the 31:48 mark which was bravely blocked.

The first goal of the match came in the 38th minute. Yacine Brahimi of FC Porto zig-zagged his way inside the box, only to see his shot saved brilliantly by the Chelsea goalkeeper. However, the rebound fell favorably for Andre, who pounced on the opportunity and slotted it home to make it 1-0 to FC Porto. The stadium erupted in celebration as Porto players and fans rejoiced at taking the lead.

Chelsea responded quickly after kick-off, and soon won a free kick in a dangerous position just before half-time. Willian stepped up and delivered an impeccable free kick right into the right post at the 46th minute, leaving the FC Porto goalkeeper with no chance to stop the shot. The teams went into half-time with the scores level at 1-1.

### Second Half:

The second half began with Chelsea taking the kick-off, but within minutes the game resumed its earlier pattern of ball possession and throw-ins. Chelsea were the first to show intent with Diego Costa getting a blocked effort from inside the box. A few corner kicks ensued, but FC Portoâ€™s defense managed to clear their lines efficiently.

Five minutes into the second half, FC Porto saw another spectacular effort as Ruben Neves sent a dangerous ball into the box from the corner, and Maicon met it perfectly to head in FC Porto's second goal at the 6:10 mark. The header nestled into the left side of the goal, making it 2-1 to FC Porto.

Chelsea tried to muster a response. Diego Costa showcased his quality with precise passes and well-timed shots, one of which even hit the crossbar around the 8:15 mark. A period of sustained pressure followed, with Chelsea making key substitutions such as Eden Hazard and Kenedy to inject fresh energy into their attack.

Chelsea continued to press FC Portoâ€™s defense, winning several corners but failing to capitalize on them. FC Porto, aiming to protect their slender lead, focused on defensive solidity and looked to hit Chelsea on the counter-attack whenever possible.
